sentence.text: Her back was aching badly now and she viewed the steep climb with some dismay .
We had no boots or gloves , and my hands and feet ached badly .
Her dark violet-blue eyes looked tired to death , and from the way she moved it was clear that her back and her ankles ached badly .
She ached inside , a sensation that had once been very familiar , but which she had deliberately suppressed over the last four years until she had almost forgotten what it had felt like .
I had been working for more than an hour and my wrists ached from the continuous chopping , but I was filled with an immense exhilaration .
I got wearily to my feet , muscles aching from the effects of drink and walk .
She smiled , her jaw aching from the effort of holding back the tears .
Fran smiled , her face aching from the effort it cost to make the lie seem like the truth .
Now his left shoulder was aching from the lightning fast , iron-handed blow he had taken .
One by one the men made the shore , weary and bedraggled , limbs aching from the strain of fighting the storm .
Sara 's arms ached from the weight of the rod and the reel .
Nuadu , aching in every bone , the lower part of his face constrained within the harsh red mask fashioned from the Robemaker 's ropes of light , had not made a sound .
The next morning Corbett woke , feeling dirty and aching in every joint .
Gentle began to follow , but the fall had left him aching in every joint , and he knew the chase was lost before he 'd hobbled three yards .
She ached in every muscle from the constant strain of trying to keep her balance on the heaving deck .
He ached in odd parts and his cuts stung with the disinfectant Cally had used .
The muscles ached in his thighs and calves .
My chest ached with a child 's fear while I cringed in the deeply recessed doorway of North Three .
Her fingers were numb , her palms aching with the sharp chill .
I 'm getting cold again , and my feet are aching with all this walking .
Too much had happened today to let her mind rest , although her body ached with fatigue .
Two hours later she was still awake , her body aching with its needs , her brain a whirling turmoil .
Carolyn 's face ached with smiling , trying to join in .
Twenty minutes later Elisa was fully recovered from the incident although her arm still ached slightly under Dr Silvino 's expert bandaging .
He ached about the head and body .
Maggie 's eyes and back are aching like hell .
Culley 's teeth ached slightly along the line of the gum ; he imagined he could feel the air trickling through his lungs like snow-melt in a delta .
Every muscle in our bodies ached under the strain .
Big drops hammered the side of his head and his face ached from being clenched to keep the water out of his eyes .
She might be so bored that her jaw ached from trying not to yawn , but Nicolo -- Nicolo looked as if he were about to explode .
Blood was spouting from cuts on my right hand , and my left foot ached a bit and felt strange -- no more .
My arm ached afterwards . "
Rachaela 's back ached continually .
Her head was aching dreadfully .
My head ached dully and altogether I was n't at my best .
It was a warm , sunny day and my feet were starting to ache .
His wrists began to ache , and his nails were empurpled with blood .
But her feet were sore , her back ached , and the complaints of her empty stomach were becoming audible .
The sun made her eyes ache .
He paused and moved in his chair , as if his bones ached .
Harry 's legs ached .
Her head ached and her throat constricted at the thought of trying to force food past the lump in her throat .
Robert 's eyes were starring to ache .
